Also, gl, my father sometimes doesn't listen
"Man, my hands are cramped.  Those handles sure do require a lot of pressure to hold them down."
Father: "That's because you were fighting the machine!  If you need to back up, that's what the reverse gear is for.  Those small handles are for turning.  You're doing more work than you need to."
Me: "Where in the FUCK does any of that statement remotely apply to my hands being cramped from holding down the handles?!?"
No, just a small exchange that didn't need to happen.
We were using the snow blower to clear off the street in front of our house.
I missed out on ten minutes after I was last here
But yeah, when I speak, I tend to be very clear with what I'm talking about.
I make a statement about my hands being tired / cramped because the handles that deliver power to the snowblower take a lot of pressure to hold down
But apparently that's because I was doing more work than I needed to in order to move the whole machine when that would be more of a full-body tiredness complaint???
